Returns an object {{tt|manip}} of unspecified type such that, given a {{c|std::basic_istream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;}} object {{tt|is}}, the expression {{c|is &gt;&gt; manip}} calls {{tt|from_stream}} (unqualified, to enable [[cpp/language/adl|argument-dependent lookup]]) as follows:
@1@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt, tp)}}
@2@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt.c_str(), tp)}}
@3@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt, tp, std::addressof(abbrev))}}
@4@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt.c_str(), tp, std::addressof(abbrev))}}
@5@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt, tp,
            static_cast&lt;std::basic_string&lt;CharT, Traits, Alloc&gt;*&gt;(nullptr), &amp;offset)}}
@6@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt.c_str(), tp,
            static_cast&lt;std::basic_string&lt;CharT, Traits, Alloc&gt;*&gt;(nullptr), &amp;offset)}}
@7@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt, tp, std::addressof(abbrev), &amp;offset)}}
@8@ {{c|from_stream(is, fmt.c_str(), tp, std::addressof(abbrev), &amp;offset)}}.

The expression {{c|is &gt;&gt; manip}} is an lvalue of type {{c|std::basic_istream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;}} with the value {{tt|is}}.

{{cpp/enable_if|the corresponding {{tt|from_stream}} expression is well-formed|plural=yes}}.

Implementations are recommended to make it difficult to use potentially dangling references to the format string, e.g., by making return types non-movable and preventing {{c|operator&gt;&gt;}} from accepting lvalues of return types.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | fmt | a format string (see below)}}
{{par | tp | object to hold the parse result}}
{{par | abbrev | string to hold the time zone abbreviation or name corresponding to the {{tt|%Z}} specifier}}
{{par | offset | duration to represent the offset from UTC corresponding to the {{tt|%z}} specifier}}
{{par end}}
